SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

com.smartitengineering.domain.annotations
Annotation Type ResourceDomain

@Documented
@Target(value=TYPE)
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface ResourceDomain

This annotation should be used to mark a domain object as a resource. If not mentioned then it will not be considered as resource and this in case of composition with a resource duing export it will be exported as a normal object rather than as a resource.

Since:
0.4
Author:
imyousuf

Optional Element Summary
 boolean accessByProperty
          For marking how to access the attributes of the resource domain.
 boolean exportAsURIByDefault
          What is the default strategy for exporting this resource domain when its associated with another resource.
 java.lang.String path
          The path to prefix the resource's id or its id's path.
 

path

public abstract java.lang.String path
The path to prefix the resource's id or its id's path. If "@Path" annotation is specified then it will be ignored

Returns:
Path to the resource domain
Since:
0.4
Default:
""

exportAsURIByDefault

public abstract boolean exportAsURIByDefault
What is the default strategy for exporting this resource domain when its associated with another resource. If true it will be exported as a URI only else it will be exported as an normal object, these will be the default behaviour.

Returns:
Whether to export as URI or not
Since:
0.4
Default:
true

accessByProperty

public abstract boolean accessByProperty
For marking how to access the attributes of the resource domain. There is only 2 choices offered - access field directly and access through getter. By default its by getters.

Returns:
False if intended access to attributes is through their fields.
Since:
0.4
Default:
true
